cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 27.64mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 15.9 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking highest from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: Rain fell for 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 creating a new record.  The storm produced a total of 24.56mm at a maximum intensity of 6.4mm per hour.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (207°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 76.85 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1570 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 20.8m higher than yesterday, 467.3m lower than the past week, 1570.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 1087.7m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and calm and still conditions are expected. Moderate rainfall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
